trans-unit.source: Interface definition for creating and deleting Internet Information Services (IIS) 6.0 virtual roots.
The IComSoapIISVRoot interface defines methods for creating and deleting virtual roots in IIS 6.0.

This interface is implemented only by the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IISVirtualRoot> class and is used only within the .NET Framework infrastructure while creating a SOAP-enabled COM+ application virtual root.
IComSoapIISVRoot does not need to be implemented directly in your code.

Instead, use the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish> class, which implements the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher> interface that contains the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.CreateVirtualRoot%2A> and <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.DeleteVirtualRoot%2A> methods.
However, <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.DeleteVirtualRoot%2A> is not fully implemented by <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish>.
IComSoapIISVRoot is used internally by the .NET Framework.
You do not need to use it directly in your code.
Creates an Internet Information Services (IIS) virtual root.
The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapIISVRoot> interface does not need to be implemented directly in your code.

Instead, use the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher> interface (implemented by the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish> class), which exposes a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.CreateVirtualRoot%2A> method.
The root Web server.
The physical path of the virtual root, which corresponds to `PhysicalPath` from the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.CreateVirtualRoot*> method.
The name of the virtual root, which corresponds to `VirtualRoot` from the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.CreateVirtualRoot*> method.
A string to which an error message can be written.
Deletes an Internet Information Services (IIS) virtual root.
The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapIISVRoot> interface does not need to be implemented directly in your code.

Alternatively, the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher> interface (implemented by the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish> class), exposes a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher.DeleteVirtualRoot%2A> method.
However, that method is not fully implemented by <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish>.
The root Web server.
The physical path of the virtual root.
The name of the virtual root.
A string to which an error message can be written.
